intro: Ainsliaea pertyoides subsp. albotomentosa, commonly known as the white-hairy ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, tubular flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its dense, white to grayish pubescence covering the stems and leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. The plant's ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate floral display and unique foliage texture.
